abstract: Terrorist attacks in Paris create sense of urgency in the United States and Europe, as concerns grow that more citizens will join extremists to fight in Iraq and Syria and potentially commit acts of terror at home; officials are renewing and reevaluating their efforts to deal with existing militants and to prevent others from joining.
lead_paragraph: The attacks in France have given new urgency to American and European efforts to prevent their citizens from going to Muslim countries to fight, and possibly becoming threats back home.

byline.contributor: Liz Alderman contributed reporting from Paris.
byline.original: By ERIC SCHMITT and MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT

snippet: The attacks in France have given new urgency to American and European efforts to prevent their citizens from going to Muslim countries to fight, and possibly becoming threats back home.

headline.main: West Struggles to Halt Flow of Citizens to War Zones
headline.print_headline: West Struggles Against Flow to War Zones
